thread.title: Tony Parker spends the night in the paint (and sculpture)

title: Tony Parker spends the night in the paint (and sculpture)
text:
Tony Parker spends the night in the paint (and sculpture) Published 5:44 pm, Thursday, October 15, 2015 Photo: Courtesy McNay Art Museum Image 1 of / 8 Close Image 1 of 8 Spur Tony Parker looks at two small-scale sculptures by Joan Miró at the McNay Art Museum. Spur Tony Parker looks at two small-scale sculptures by Joan Miró at the McNay Art Museum. Photo: Courtesy McNay Art Museum Image 2 of 8 Spur Tony Parker spent much of a recent 90-minute visit to the McNay Art Museum looking at sculptures in an exhibit of work by Joan Miró. Spur Tony Parker spent much of a recent 90-minute visit to the McNay Art Museum looking at sculptures in an exhibit of work by Joan Miró. Photo: Courtesy McNay Art Museum Image 3 of 8 Spur Tony Parker pauses in front of "Head, Bird," one of the works by Joan Miró currently on exhibit at the McNay Art Museum. Spur Tony Parker pauses in front of "Head, Bird," one of the works by Joan Miró currently on exhibit at the McNay Art Museum. Photo: Courtesy McNay Art Museum Image 4 of 8 Spur Tony Parker had a private tour of "Miro: The Experience of Seeing," an exhibit of painting and sculpture by Joan Miró at the McNay Art Museum, Saturday after closing. Spur Tony Parker had a private tour of "Miro: The Experience of Seeing," an exhibit of painting and sculpture by Joan Miró at the McNay Art Museum, Saturday after closing. Photo: Courtesy McNay Art Museum Image 5 of 8 Spur Tony Parker points out a detail in “Figure,” a painted bronze by Joan Miró, at the McNay Art Museum. Spur Tony Parker points out a detail in “Figure,” a painted bronze by Joan Miró, at the McNay Art Museum. Photo: Courtesy McNay Art Museum Image 6 of 8 Spur Tony Parker enjoyed identifying the disparate objects artist Joan Miró used to make sculptures on display at the McNay Art Museum. Spur Tony Parker enjoyed identifying the disparate objects artist Joan Miró used to make sculptures on display at the McNay Art Museum. Photo: Courtesy McNay Art Museum Image 7 of 8 Spur Tony Parker looks at Joan Miró's "Woman and Bird in the Night" at the McNay Art Museum. Spur Tony Parker looks at Joan Miró's "Woman and Bird in the Night" at the McNay Art Museum. Photo: Courtesy McNay Art Museum Image 8 of 8 Tony Parker spends the night in the paint (and sculpture) 1 / 8 Back to Gallery 
Spur Tony Parker and wife Axelle Francine spent part of Saturday evening taking in the paintings, drawings and sculptures by Joan Miró currently on display at the McNay Art Museum . 
The museum arranged a private, after-hours visit for the couple after receiving a call from the team. Museum director William Chiego and his wife took them through the exhibit, which features 50 works by the Spanish-born artist known for bold, colorful compositions. 
Chiego said the Spurs point guard spent a lot of the 90-minute visit looking at the sculptures and enjoyed identifying the disparate objects Miró used to create them. 
“There’s one piece that looks like it has a grill attached to it for maybe cooking something, but (Parker) knew immediately it was something used in France for drying clothes,” Chiego said. “So that was very interesting, because Miró spent a lot of time in Paris.” 
The couple had to leave because they had dinner reservations, but not before making a stop in the education area where visitors can make their own sculptures. 
“I told them they needed to come back and make something,” Chiego said. “(Parker) wanted to come back and bring his mom. We hope they will.” 
“Miró: The Experience of Seeing” is at the McNay Art Museum, 6000 N. New Braunfels, through Jan. 10. 
lsilva@express-news.net
